page.title: 02Survey Of Local Attitudes
page.content: A survey completed specially for the Domesday Project questioned local people about life in Britain in the 1980's and asked for their views of the "state of the nation". 50% wanted the electoral system changed to some form of proportional representation , 40% wanted independence for Scotland, 95% were happy with the role of the Royal Family in modern society, 85% thought our society was too violent and uncaring,95% thought the courts were too lenient with law-breakers and 80% wanted the Death Penalty re-introduced. The general feeling was that society's values have changed. People are more mercinary and "for themselves",they complain too much to authority and want too much done for them, instead of striving to do things for themselves.
